intro: Hymenogyne glabra, commonly known as the smooth hymenogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in cymes, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature.
